page.title: 17CHURCHES
page.content: {Saint Mary's},a rare commonwealth church was built in 1657. The Ward family who owned Northwood House and park were devout Catholics. They paid for the John Nash tower to be built in 1874 and for the renovations of the body of the church in 1867. The church seats 900 and has two galleries. It has an organ built in 1874, a sundial over the glass door dated 1762 and stained glass windows dedicated to families in Cowes.An underground passage leads to Northwood Park. In East Cowes the{Convent of Our Lady is the home for twelve sisters of an open order who run Holy Cross school. The house is believed to have been built by Sir George Shedden for his bride to be and is still visited by members of the Shedden family.
